channel.title: CVE Feed for Microsoft Corporation -- Windows 10 1607, and 1703, and Windows Server 2016
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Microsoft Corporation -- Windows 10 1607, and 1703, and Windows Server 2016

item.title: CVE-2017-8596|2024-08-05T16:41:24.167Z -- microsoft%20corporation -- windows%2010%201607%2C%20and%201703%2C%20and%20windows%20server%202016
item.description: Microsoft Edge in Microsoft Windows 10 1607, and 1703, and Windows Server 2016 allow an attacker to execute arbitrary code in the context of the current user when the JavaScript engine fails to render when handling objects in memory in Microsoft Edge, aka "Scripting Engine Memory Corruption Vulnerability". This CVE ID is unique from CVE-2017-8598, CVE-2017-8610, CVE-2017-8595, CVE-2017-8601, CVE-2017-8603, CVE-2017-8604, CVE-2017-8605, CVE-2017-8606, CVE-2017-8607, CVE-2017-8608, and CVE-2017-8609.
